p: TBEV is reported in the northern hemisphere of Europe and Asia. There are three main subtypes of TBEV: European (TBEV-Eu), Siberian (TBEV-Si) and Far Eastern (TBEV-FE) circulating in Europe with TBEV-Si and TBEV-FE recently detected in the Baltic countries and in Eastern Finland [ 138, 139]. Based on epidemiological investigations, LIV distribution area initially limited to the British Isles (particularly in Scotland, Cumbria, Wales, Devon and Ireland), but seroconversion or clinical cases in sheep due to LIV-like viruses have been reported during the last decade in Norway, Denmark, and Spain [ 140, 141].
